page.title: 19TOURISM
page.content: TOURISM IS NOT ONE OF THE MAJOR INDUSTRIES IN THE AREA.THIS BLOCK IS SITUATED MIDWAY BETWEEN THE DERBYSHIRE PEAK DISTRICT AND NORTH WALES.THUS THE MAIN TOURISM IS IN THESE AREAS AND THE PEOPLE OF THIS AREA ARE WITHIN EASY REACH OF THESE AND OTHER RECREATIONAL AREAS.THE MAIN TYPES OF ORGANISED HOLIDAY IN THE AREA INVOLVE THE USE OF BOATS AND BARGES WHICH USE THE MANY WATERWAYS WHICH PASS THROUGH NORTHWICH.THE NAVIGABLE RIVER WEAVER AND THE TRENT AND MERSEY CANAL ARE TWO SUCH WATERWAYS AND HOLIDAYS OF THIS TYPE PROVIDE A VERY ENJOYABLE BREAK. NORTHWICH IS SO CLOSE TO THE CENTRES OF MANCHESTER AND LIVERPOOL THAT IT HAS NO NEED TO BE A POPULAR TOURISM CENTRE.AND WITH CHESTER ONLY SIXTEEN MILES AWAY NORTHWICH IS A TOWN WHICH IS PASSED THROUGH RATHER THAN STOPPED IN.
